s.comment: as mentioned in the first round of sense tagging, the "fair" in this sentence has a slightly different sense than the ones offered as choices; I think "fair" here should be tagged as "a considerable amount", but no such sense exists like this, so I have elected to choose sense 2, though I don't think it matches well enough.

list.s: While Harvard may cost a fair deal more than a local community college, the Harvard grad leaves with an education that almost guarantees him or her a job that will equip him or her to both pay off the loan and pay more in taxes.

s.comment: "fair" here is being used as a noun.
